text: Anthony Michael Romaniw (born September 15, 1991 in Hamilton, Ontario) is a Canadian track and field athlete competing in the middle distance events, predominantly the 800m event.COC ProifleIAAF Profile He competed in the 800 metres at the 2015 Pan American Games in Toronto, where he finished 15th. He represented his country at the 2016 Summer Olympics without reaching the semifinals. At St. Thomas More Catholic Secondary School, Romaniw was a four sport star in track and cross country where he was the MVP on both teams, badminton and was the captain of the hockey team three times. He ran two years at Dartmouth Collegehttps://dartmouthsports.com/roster.aspx?rp_id=3987 before moving back home to finish at the University of Guelph. ==International competitions== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |2010 |World Junior Championships |Moncton, Canada |12th (h) |800 m |1:49.26 |- |rowspan=2|2013 |Universiade |Kazan, Russia |7th |800 m |1:49.04 |- |World Championships |Moscow, Russia |34th (h) |800 m |1:47.98 |- |2015 |Pan American Games |Toronto, Canada |15th (h) |800 m |1:56.55 |- |2016 |Olympic Games |Rio de Janeiro, Brazil |27th (h) |800 m |1:47.59 |} ==References== Category:1991 births Category:Living people Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2015 Pan American Games Category:Pan American Games competitors for Canada Category:Sportspeople from Hamilton, Ontario Category:Canadian male middle- distance runners Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2016 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic track and field athletes of Canada Category:Competitors at the 2013 Summer Universiade
title: Anthony Romaniw
